Model.Name: Disc_CF_Model
Model.Notes: Calculates present value of all cashflows for conventional business

Input.Name: BenType
Input.Notes: Benefit LEVEL or DECR over lifetime of policy (DECR applicable to Product = TERM only)

Input.Name: Benefit
Input.Notes: Inputs related to benefits under policy

Input.Name: DthBen
Input.Notes: Death benefit sum assured, ie the amount of life cover provided, at policy commencement

Input.Name: LifeBasis
Input.Notes: Single life (S), Joint Life First Death (JLF). Joint Life Last Death (JLL)

Input.Name: MatValue
Input.Notes: Maturity benefit, ie amount paid on survival until end of policy. This should be the value set at policy commencement, even if policy is now paid up.

Input.Name: PUPDate
Input.Notes: Date when policy was made paid up (blank if not applicable)

Input.Name: PremAnn
Input.Notes: Annual premium amount. For single premiums this is the single premium, for all other premium frequencies this is the annual premium.

Input.Name: PremFreq
Input.Notes: Number of premiums paid each year, 0=single premium, 1=annual, 2=half-yearly, 3=termly, 4=quarterly, 12=monthly

Input.Name: PremTerm
Input.Notes: Premium payment term in years. (0 for single premiums, if premiums paid for whole term then set equal to Term, otherwise set to number of years premiums will be paid for).

Input.Name: Product
Input.Notes: Product Type: Term insurance (TERM), Whole of life assurance (WOL), Pure Endowment (PURE_ENDOW), Endowment (ENDOW)

Input.Name: Term
Input.Notes: Term of policy (from commencement) in years (blank for WOL Product)

Parameter.Name: Ben_on_Dth
Parameter.Notes: Product pays out on death (Y/N)

Parameter.Name: Ben_on_Mat
Parameter.Notes: Product pays out on survival to maturity (Y/N)

Parameter.Name: Ben_on_PUP
Parameter.Notes: Can the benefits under the policy become paid up (Y/N)

Parameter.Name: Ben_on_Surr
Parameter.Notes: Product pays out on surrender (Y/N)

Parameter.Name: CalcBasis_w
Parameter.Notes: Set within code to Reserve or Pricing

Parameter.Name: CalcType
Parameter.Notes: Reserve, BenLed, PremLed

Parameter.Name: DecrSA_Int
Parameter.Notes: Interest rate used to calculate the decreasing sum assured on DECR policies

Parameter.Name: DecrSA_MrtgPmt_w
Parameter.Notes: Monthly payment required to pay off mortgage amount equal to the sum assured at outset, assuming fixed interest rate of DecrSA_Int

Parameter.Name: ExpBasis_tbl
Parameter.Notes: Expense basis table, varies by Product and CalcBasis_w (Reserve or Pricing)

Parameter.Name: ExpClaim
Parameter.Notes: Claims Expenses - applied at time of claim (which is assumed to happen at the end of the month in which claim occurs)

Parameter.Name: ExpInfl
Parameter.Notes: Expense Inflation - applied annually from the valuation date to all expenses

Parameter.Name: ExpInit
Parameter.Notes: Initial Expenses - applied at the beginning of the first policy month

Parameter.Name: ExpRen
Parameter.Notes: Renewal Expenses - applied at the end of each policy year

Parameter.Name: GoalSeekResult_w
Parameter.Notes: Used in PremLed and BenLed calculations

Parameter.Name: PUPRate
Parameter.Notes: Annual pup rate appropriate to policy

Parameter.Name: PUPRate_tbl
Parameter.Notes: Table showing annual rate at which plans become paid up, varies by Product

Parameter.Name: PersistencyBasis_tbl
Parameter.Notes: Table used to determine appropriate lapse basis dependent on risk factors specific to each policy

Parameter.Name: PersistencyMaxRows_w
Parameter.Notes: Final row in lapse table, used when looking up lapse rates after end of table (where final rate is assumed to apply indefinitely)

Parameter.Name: PersistencyTbl_w
Parameter.Notes: Lapse table applicable to policy

Parameter.Name: PremTerm_w
Parameter.Notes: Premium paying term (in months) calculated in code for WOL plans and set to Input PremTerm * 12 otherwise

Parameter.Name: ProdBens_tbl
Parameter.Notes: Table showing the benefits available on each Product

Parameter.Name: SM_Mortality_Life1
Parameter.Notes: Mortality submodel used to calculate mortality for life 1

Parameter.Name: SM_Mortality_Life2
Parameter.Notes: Mortality submodel used to calculate mortality for life 2

Parameter.Name: SurrCharge_Tbl
Parameter.Notes: Surrender charge table, varies by PolYear and Product

Parameter.Name: SurrChgeMaxRows_w
Parameter.Notes: Last row in surrender charge table

Parameter.Name: Term_w
Parameter.Notes: Term of policy (in months) calculated in code for WOL product. For other products set to Input Term * 12 but restricted in code to the month in which the appropriate lives die.

Parameter.Name: ValDate
Parameter.Notes: Valuation date

Parameter.Name: ValIntMaxRows_w
Parameter.Notes: Last row for which there are values in the valuation interest rate table

Parameter.Name: Val_Int_tbl
Parameter.Notes: Valuation interest rate table used to discount cashflows (lookup based on year of projection)

Formula.Name: BothAlive_b
Formula.Notes: Proportion of joint life policies where both lives are still alive at the start of the month
Formula.Value:
'Probability both lives are alive at the start of month t ' used in joint life last death calculations and in calculation of survival benefits
'Not Required for single life policies If LifeBasis = "S" Then Return 0
Return Life1Alive_b(t) * Life2Alive_b(t)

Formula.Name: DeathRate
Formula.Notes: Proportion of policies that were in force at the valuation date that claim through death in month t
Formula.Value:
'Probability of policy claiming as a result of death(s) in month t
'Single life policies If LifeBasis = "S" Then Return MortRate1(t)
'Joint life policies If LifeBasis = "JLF" Then 'claim when either life dies Return MortRate1(t) + MortRate2(t) - MortRate1(t) * MortRate2(t) Else 'Joint Life Last death - claim when both lives die '(= prob both die in month t + prob life 1 dies in month t (life 2 died before month t) + prob life 2 dies in month t (life 1 died before month t) Return ((BothAlive_b(t) * MortRate1(t) * MortRate2(t)) _ + (Life1Alive_b(t) * (1 - Life2Alive_b(t)) * MortRate1(t)) _ + (Life2Alive_b(t) * (1 - Life1Alive_b(t)) * MortRate2(t)) ) _ / (Life1Alive_b(t) + Life2Alive_b(t) - Life1Alive_b(t) * Life2Alive_b(t)) End If

Formula.Name: DiscFac_mnth
Formula.Notes: Monthly discount factor appropriate during month t
Formula.Value:
'Assume no discounting applies before valuation date If t <= PeriodIF() Then Return 1
'Lookup annual interest rate (use last rate for period > end of table) and calculate monthly discount factor Return 1 / ((1 + Val_Int_tbl.Value(Min(ValYr(t), ValIntMaxRows_w), Product & "_" & CalcBasis_w) ) ^ (1 / 12))

Formula.Name: DthBen_PP_IF_e
Formula.Notes: Death benefit paid to premium paying policies claiming in month t
Formula.Value:
'No death benefits on policy or before policy commencement If Ben_on_Dth = "N" Or t <= 0 Then Return 0
'Death benefit paid to premium paying policies claiming in month t Return PropIF_e(t - 1) * DeathRate(t) * (1 - PropPUP_e(t - 1)) * DthBen_PP_PU(t)

Formula.Name: DthBen_PP_PU
Formula.Notes: Death benefit per unit in month t for premium paying policies
Formula.Value:
'No death benefits on policy or before policy commencement If Ben_on_Dth = "N" Or t <= 0 Then Return 0
'LEVEL policies - Sum assured is set at outset an remains constant throughout If BenType = "LEVEL" Then If CalcType = "PremLed" Then Return GoalSeekResult_w Return DthBen End If
'DECR policies 'For Premium Led projections re-calculate typical mortgage payment assuming fixed interest Of DecrSA_Int If CalcType = "PremLed" Then DecrSA_MrtgPmt_w = Financial.Pmt((1 + DecrSA_Int) ^ (1 / 12) - 1, Term * 12, GoalSeekResult_w)
'Assume the Sum assured is equal to capital outstanding on a mortgage at end of month t where the mortgage has a fixed interest rate of DecrSA_Int Return Financial.PV((1 + DecrSA_Int) ^ (1 / 12) - 1, Term * 12 - (t - 1), DecrSA_MrtgPmt_w)

Formula.Name: DthBen_PUP_IF_e
Formula.Notes: Death benefit paid to paid up policies claiming in month t
Formula.Value:
'Before policy commencement, no death benefits or PUP option on product or single premium policy If t <= 0 Or Ben_on_Dth = "N" Or Ben_on_PUP = "N" Or PremFreq = 0 Then Return 0
Return PropIF_e(t - 1) * DeathRate(t) * DthBen_PUP_PU(t)

Formula.Name: DthBen_PUP_PU
Formula.Notes: Death benefit per unit in month t for paid up plans
Formula.Value:
'Before policy commencement, no death benefits or PUP option on product or single premium policy If t <= 0 Or Ben_on_Dth = "N" Or Ben_on_PUP = "N" Or PremFreq = 0 Then Return 0
Return DthBen_PUP_PU(t - 1) + PropPUPinMth(t - 1) * DthBen_PUPinMth(t - 1)

Formula.Name: DthBen_PUPinMth
Formula.Notes: Death benefit per unit for policies that are made paid up in month t
Formula.Value:
'Before policy commencement, no death benefits or PUP option on product or single premium policy If t <= 0 Or Ben_on_Dth = "N" Or Ben_on_PUP = "N" Or PremFreq = 0 Then Return 0
'Death benefit sum assured reduced depending on no. of premiums due and no. of premiums paid Return DthBen_PP_PU(t) * Ceiling(Min(t, PremTerm_w) / (12 / PremFreq)) / (PremTerm_w / (12 / PremFreq) )

Formula.Name: DthBen_PV_e
Formula.Notes: Present value (at end of month t) of all death claims paid from month t+1 onwards
Formula.Value:
'Present Value at the end of month t of all death claims paid from month t+1 onwards
If t = ProjTerm() Then Return 0
Return (DthBen_PV_e(t + 1) + DthBen_TOT_IF_e(t + 1) ) * DiscFac_mnth(t + 1)

Formula.Name: DthBen_TOT_IF_e
Formula.Notes: Total death benefit claims paid at the end of month t on both premium paying and paid up policies
Formula.Value:
'Before policy commencement or no death benefit on product If t <= 0 Or Ben_on_Dth = "N" Then Return 0
'Total Expected death claims from premium paying and paid up policies at the end of month t Return DthBen_PP_IF_e(t) + DthBen_PUP_IF_e(t)

Formula.Name: Execute
Formula.Notes: Determines which functions will be calculated
Formula.Value:
If CalcBasis_w = "Reserve" Then Record.CalcFns()
'Reset GoalSeekResult_w GoalSeekResult_w = 1
If CalcBasis_w = "Pricing" Then Record.GoalSeek(GoalSeekResult_w, 0, AddressOf GoalseekTarget_w, 0.00000001)

Formula.Name: ExpClaim_IF_e
Formula.Notes: Claims expenses from policies that claim in month t, paid at the end of month t
Formula.Value:
'Claim expenses for policies claiming through death, surrender or maturity in month t If t <= 0 Then Return 0
Dim ClaimRate As Double = 0
If Ben_on_Dth = "Y" Then ClaimRate = PropIF_e(t - 1) * DeathRate(t)
If Ben_on_Surr = "Y" Then ClaimRate = ClaimRate + (PropIF_e(t - 1) * (1 - DeathRate(t)) * SurrRate(t))
If Ben_on_Mat = "Y" And t = ProjTerm() Then ClaimRate = ClaimRate + PropIF_e(t)
Return ExpClaim_PU(t) * ClaimRate

Formula.Name: ExpClaim_PU
Formula.Notes: Per unit claim expenses at the end of month t
Formula.Value:
'No claims before policy commencement If t <= 0 Then Return 0
'Expense assumptions apply at valuation date, inflation applied annually from then (both prior to and after valuation date) Return ExpClaim * (1 + ExpInfl) ^ (Floor(ValMnth(t) / 12))

Formula.Name: ExpInit_b
Formula.Notes: Initial expenses incurred at the beginning of the first policy month
Formula.Value: 'Initial expenses only paid at the start of the first policy month If t = 1 Then 'Expense assumptions apply at valuation date, inflation applied annually from then Return ExpInit * (1 + ExpInfl) ^ (Floor(ValMnth(t) / 12)) Else Return 0 End If

Formula.Name: ExpRen_IF_e
Formula.Notes: Renewal expenses from those policies still in force at the end of each policy year
Formula.Value:
'Renewal expense from policies still in force at time t If t <= 0 Then Return 0
Return ExpRen_PU(t) * PropIF_e(t)

Formula.Name: ExpRen_PU
Formula.Notes: Per unit renewal expense at the end of each policy year
Formula.Value:
'Renewal expenses assumed to occur annually from policy commencement date, but no renewal expense in last policy month If t <= 0 Or t Mod 12 <> 0 Or t = ProjTerm() Then Return 0
'Expense assumptions apply at valuation date, inflation applied annually from then Return ExpRen * (1 + ExpInfl) ^ (Floor(ValMnth(t) / 12))

Formula.Name: GoalseekTarget_w
Formula.Notes: Target column used to goalseek for required premium/benefit for given benefit/premium
Formula.Value:
'Only required for Pricing projections If CalcBasis_w = "Reserve" Then Return 0
Return Res_e(0)

Formula.Name: InitRecord
Formula.Notes: Set up any variables that only need calculated once for each policy
Formula.Value:
'Don't call life 2 mortality submodel for single life policies If LifeBasis = "S" Then SM_Mortality_Life2.Skip = True
'Set Term_w (term of policy in months) 'Call Mortality submodel InitRecord to get max possible term (MaxTerm_w) SM_Mortality_Life1.InitRecord If LifeBasis <> "S" Then SM_Mortality_Life2.InitRecord
'Set Term_w to MaxTerm_w for WOL Product If Product = "WOL" Then If LifeBasis = "S" Then Term_w = SM_Mortality_Life1.MaxTerm_w Else If LifeBasis = "JLF" Then Term_w = Min(SM_Mortality_Life1.MaxTerm_w, SM_Mortality_Life2.MaxTerm_w) If LifeBasis = "JLL" Then Term_w = Max(SM_Mortality_Life1.MaxTerm_w, SM_Mortality_Life2.MaxTerm_w) End If
Else 'Not WOL If LifeBasis = "S" Then Term_w = Min(CInt(Term * 12), SM_Mortality_Life1.MaxTerm_w) Else If LifeBasis = "JLF" Then Term_w = Min(CInt(Term * 12), _ Min(SM_Mortality_Life1.MaxTerm_w, SM_Mortality_Life2.MaxTerm_w) ) If LifeBasis = "JLL" Then Term_w = Min(CInt(Term * 12), _ Max(SM_Mortality_Life1.MaxTerm_w, SM_Mortality_Life2.MaxTerm_w) ) End If End If
'Check is premiums paid for restricted term, if not then set PremTerm_w to Term_w If PremTerm > 0 Then PremTerm_w = Min(CInt(PremTerm * 12), Term_w) Else PremTerm_w = Term_w End If
'Set Lapse Basis Dim lookup As String Dim Tablename As String
'Set Appropriate Lapse Table 'Regular Or Single Premium? Dim PremType As String If PremFreq = 0 Then PremType = "S" Else PremType = "R"
'Is Premium paying term less than Term of policy? Dim PremTermRed As String If PremFreq > 0 And PremTerm_w < Term_w Then PremTermRed = "Y" Else PremTermRed = "N"
'Lookup LapseBasis lookup = Table.GetLookUp(Product, CalcBasis_w, PremType, PremTermRed, BenType) Tablename = PersistencyBasis_tbl.Value(lookup) PersistencyTbl_w = Project.TableDbl(Tablename) PersistencyMaxRows_w = PersistencyTbl_w.Rows
'For Decreasing policies calculate typical mortgage payment assuming fixed interest Of DecrSA_Int If BenType = "DECR" Then DecrSA_MrtgPmt_w = Financial.Pmt((1 + DecrSA_Int) ^ (1 / 12) - 1, Term * 12, DthBen)

Formula.Name: Initialise
Formula.Notes: Set up projection specific variables - function calculated once per projection
Formula.Value:
'Set Calculation basis to Reserve or Pricing If CalcType = "Reserve" Then CalcBasis_w = "Reserve" Else CalcBasis_w = "Pricing" End If
'Set last row of surrender charge table SurrChgeMaxRows_w = SurrCharge_Tbl.Rows
'Set last row of valuation interest rate table ValIntMaxRows_w = Val_Int_tbl.Rows

Formula.Name: Life1Alive_b
Formula.Notes: Proportion of policies where life 1 is still alive at the start of the month
Formula.Value:
'Probability life 1 still alive at the start of month t ' used in joint life last death calculations and in calculation of survival benefits
Return SM_Mortality_Life1.LifeAlive_b(t)

Formula.Name: Life2Alive_b
Formula.Notes: Proportion of joint life policies where life 2 is still alive at the start of the month
Formula.Value:
'Probability life 2 still alive at the start of month t ' used in joint life last death calculations and in calculation of survival benefits
'Not Required for single life policies If LifeBasis = "S" Then Return 0
Return SM_Mortality_Life2.LifeAlive_b(t)

Formula.Name: MatBen_IF_e
Formula.Notes: Total maturity benefit paid at the end of month t on both premium paying and paid up policies
Formula.Value:
'Before maturity or no maturity benefit on product If t < ProjTerm() Or Ben_on_Mat = "N" Then Return 0
Return MatBen_PP_IF_e(t) + MatBen_PUP_IF_e(t)

Formula.Name: MatBen_PP_IF_e
Formula.Notes: Maturity benefit paid to premium paying policies maturing in month t
Formula.Value:
'Before maturity or no maturity benefits on product If t < ProjTerm() Or Ben_on_Mat = "N" Then Return 0
'For premium led projections, set maturity value to be the goalseek value If CalcType = "PremLed" Then Return PropIF_e(t) * (1 - PropPUP_e(t - 1)) * GoalSeekResult_w Else Return PropIF_e(t) * (1 - PropPUP_e(t - 1)) * MatValue End If

Formula.Name: MatBen_PUP_IF_e
Formula.Notes: Maturity benefit paid to paid up plans maturing in month t
Formula.Value:
'Before maturity, no maturity benefits or PUP option on product or single premium policy If t < ProjTerm() Or Ben_on_Mat = "N" Or Ben_on_PUP = "N" Or PremFreq = 0 Then Return 0
Dim i As Integer Dim MatBenPUP As Double = 0
'Loop through for plans that were made paid up in each month t (no PUPs assumed at t = ProjTerm) For i = 1 To t - 1 MatBenPUP = MatBenPUP + PropPUPinMth(i) * MatBen_PUPinMth(i) Next
Return MatBenPUP * PropIF_e(t)

Formula.Name: MatBen_PUPinMth
Formula.Notes: Maturity benefit for plans that are made paid up in month t
Formula.Value:
'Before policy commencement, no maturity benefits or PUP option on product or single premium policy If t <= 0 Or Ben_on_Mat = "N" Or Ben_on_PUP = "N" Or PremFreq = 0 Then Return 0
'For premium led projections, set maturity value to be the goalseek value If CalcType = "PremLed" Then Return GoalSeekResult_w * Ceiling(Min(t, PremTerm_w) / (12 / PremFreq)) _ / (PremTerm_w / (12 / PremFreq) ) Else 'Else use MatValue Input Return MatValue * Ceiling(Min(t, PremTerm_w) / (12 / PremFreq)) _ / (PremTerm_w / (12 / PremFreq) ) End If

Formula.Name: Maturity_PV_e
Formula.Notes: Present value (at end of month t) of all maturity claims paid from month t+1 onwards
Formula.Value:
'Present Value at the end of month t of all maturity benefits paid from month t+1 onwards
If t = ProjTerm() Then Return 0
Return (MatBen_IF_e(t + 1) + Maturity_PV_e(t + 1)) * DiscFac_mnth(t + 1)

Formula.Name: MortRate1
Formula.Notes: Probability of life 1 dying during month t
Formula.Value:
'Assume zero mortality until the later of valuation date and policy commencement date If t <= Max(PeriodIF(), 0) Then Return 0
Return SM_Mortality_Life1.MortRate(t)

Formula.Name: MortRate2
Formula.Notes: Probability of life 2 dying during month t
Formula.Value:
'Only required for joint life policies, assume zero mortality until the later of valuation date and policy commencement date If LifeBasis = "S" Or t <= Max(PeriodIF(), 0) Then Return 0
Return SM_Mortality_Life2.MortRate(t)

Formula.Name: PUP_mnth
Formula.Notes: Policy month in which policy is made paid up
Formula.Value: 'Number of months from outset to PUP date - used for policies that have been made paid up prior to the valuation date Return DateSpan.TermInMonths(StartDate, PUPDate) + 1

Formula.Name: PeriodIF
Formula.Notes: Complete months from policy commencement date to valuation date
Formula.Value: 'Number of complete months from policy commencement to valuation date Return DateSpan.TermInMonths(StartDate, ValDate)

Formula.Name: Pol_Year
Formula.Notes: Policy year
Formula.Value: 'Policy year, ie first 12 months from policy commencement = Pol_Year 1, next 12 months = Pol_Year 2 Return CInt(Fix((t + 11) / 12))

Formula.Name: Prem_PP_IF_b
Formula.Notes: Premium received after allowing for claims/lapses/PUPs. Premiums assumed to be paid at start of month t.
Formula.Value:
'No premiums before policy commencement If t <= 0 Then Return 0
'Premiums from policies still in force AND not paid up at the end of the previous period Return Prem_PU(t) * PropIF_e(t - 1) * (1 - PropPUP_e(t - 1))

Formula.Name: Prem_PU
Formula.Notes: Premium per unit due in month t
Formula.Value:
'Premium due at the start of month t (assuming policy still In force)
'SINGLE PREMIUMS If PremFreq = 0 And t = 1 Then If CalcType = "BenLed" Then Return GoalSeekResult_w Return PremAnn End If
'REGULAR PREMIUMS 'Return zero before policy commences OR after the premium paying term OR where no premium due in month t If t <= 0 Or t > PremTerm_w Or (t - 1)Mod(12 / PremFreq) <> 0 Then Return 0
'Premium due this month If CalcType = "BenLed" Then Return GoalSeekResult_w / PremFreq Return PremAnn / PremFreq

Formula.Name: Prem_PV_e
Formula.Notes: Present value (at end of month t) for all premiums paid from month t+1 onwards
Formula.Value:
'Present Value at the end of month t of all premiums paid from month t+1 onwards
If t = ProjTerm() Then Return 0
Return Prem_PV_e(t + 1) * DiscFac_mnth(t + 1) + Prem_PP_IF_b(t + 1)

Formula.Name: ProjTerm
Formula.Notes: Term of projection in months from policy commencement
Formula.Value: 'Projection term from outset (in months) 'For WOL this is calculated as the time until the appropriate lives reach the max age in the mortality table 'For other products this is set to the minimum of the Input variable Term * 12 and the max age in mortality table Return Term_w

Formula.Name: PropIF_e
Formula.Notes: Proportion of policies still in force at the end of month t (after all claims and lapses)
Formula.Value:
'Proportion still in force at the end of month t 'Assume policy is still in force at later of policy commencement and valuation date If t <= Max(0, PeriodIF()) Then Return 1
Return PropIF_e(t - 1) * (1 - DeathRate(t) ) * (1 - SurrRate(t))

Formula.Name: PropPUP_e
Formula.Notes: Proportion of in force polices that are paid up at the end of month t (after all claims and lapses)
Formula.Value:
'Proportion of in force policies that are paid up at time t 'All policies are premium paying at outset and single premium policies can't be made paid up (as all benefits paid for in advance) If t <= 0 Or PremFreq = 0 Or Ben_on_PUP = "N" Then Return 0
'No additional paid up policies in last month of policy If t = ProjTerm() Then Return PropPUP_e(t - 1)
'Set to 100% in appropriate month for policies that were paid up during the PeriodIF If t = PUP_mnth() Then Return 1
'Assume policies are only made paid up in the month prior to a premium being due If Prem_PU(t + 1) > 0 And t > PeriodIF() Then Return 1 - (1 - PropPUP_e(t - 1)) * (1 - PUPRate) ^ (1 / PremFreq)
Return PropPUP_e(t - 1)

Formula.Name: PropPUPinMth
Formula.Notes: Proportion of in force polices that are made paid up in month t
Formula.Value:
'Proportion of in force policies becoming paid up in month t 'PUP benefits not applicable to single premium policies If t <= 0 Or PremFreq = 0 Or Ben_on_PUP = "N" Then Return 0
Return PropPUP_e(t) - PropPUP_e(t - 1)

Formula.Name: Res_e
Formula.Notes: Reserve at end of month t
Formula.Value:
'Calculate reserve at the end of month t
If t = ProjTerm() Then Return 0
Return DthBen_PV_e(t) + Maturity_PV_e(t) + Surr_PV_e(t) + TotExp_PV_e(t) - Prem_PV_e(t)

Formula.Name: SurrBen_IF_e
Formula.Notes: Total surrender benefit paid at the end of month t to both premium paying and paid up policies
Formula.Value:
'Before policy commencement or no surrender benefit on product If t <= 0 Or Ben_on_Surr = "N" Then Return 0
'After period in which a surrender charge applies If Pol_Year(t) > SurrChgeMaxRows_w Then Return SurrBen_PP_IF_e(t) + SurrBen_PUP_IF_e(t)
'Surrender benefit less surrender charge Return (SurrBen_PP_IF_e(t) + SurrBen_PUP_IF_e(t)) * (1 - SurrCharge_Tbl.Value(Pol_Year(t), Product))

Formula.Name: SurrBen_PP_IF_e
Formula.Notes: Surrender benefit paid to premium paying policies surrendering in month t
Formula.Value:
'Before policy commencement or no surrender benefit on product If t <= 0 Or Ben_on_Surr = "N" Then Return 0
'Surrender benefit paid to premium paying policies surrendering in month t Return PropIF_e(t - 1) * (1 - DeathRate(t)) * SurrRate(t) * (1 - PropPUP_e(t - 1)) * SurrBen_PP_PU(t)

Formula.Name: SurrBen_PP_PU
Formula.Notes: Surrender benefit per unit in month t for premium paying policies
Formula.Value:
'Before policy commencement or no surrender benefit on product If t <= 0 Or Ben_on_Surr = "N" Then Return 0
'Surrender benefit at time t is the sum of all premiums paid up until (and incl) time t Return SurrBen_PP_PU(t - 1) + Prem_PU(t)

Formula.Name: SurrBen_PUP_IF_e
Formula.Notes: Surrender benefit paid to paid up policies surrendering in month t
Formula.Value:
'Before policy commencement, no surrender benefits or PUP option on product or single premium policy If t <= 0 Or Ben_on_Surr = "N" Or Ben_on_PUP = "N" Or PremFreq = 0 Then Return 0
Return PropIF_e(t - 1) * (1 - DeathRate(t)) * SurrRate(t) * SurrBen_PUP_PU(t)

Formula.Name: SurrBen_PUP_PU
Formula.Notes: Surrender benefit per unit in month t for paid up plans
Formula.Value:
'Before policy commencement, no surrender benefits or PUP option on product or single premium policy If t <= 0 Or Ben_on_Surr = "N" Or Ben_on_PUP = "N" Or PremFreq = 0 Then Return 0
Return SurrBen_PUP_PU(t - 1) + PropPUPinMth(t - 1) * SurrBen_PP_PU(t - 1)

Formula.Name: SurrRate
Formula.Notes: Proportion of in force policies assumed to lapse/surrender at end of month t. Assumed to occur after any deaths during the month.
Formula.Value:
'Assume policy still in force at later of policy commencement and valuation date If t <= Max(0, PeriodIF()) Then Return 0
If t = ProjTerm() Then Return 0 ' Assume no lapses/surrenders in last month of policy
'Lapses (ie no benefit payable on exit) If Ben_on_Surr = "N" Then 'Assume lapses only happen immediately before a premium is due If Prem_PU(t + 1) > 0 Then Return 1 - (1 - PersistencyTbl_w.value(Min(Pol_Year(t), PersistencyMaxRows_w))) ^ (1 / PremFreq) Else ' Surrenders 'Assume surrender can happen at any point Return 1 - (1 - PersistencyTbl_w.value(Min(Pol_Year(t), PersistencyMaxRows_w))) ^ (1 / 12) End If

Formula.Name: Surr_PV_e
Formula.Notes: Present value (at end of month t) of all surrender claims paid from month t+1 onwards
Formula.Value:
'Present Value at the end of month t of all surrender claims paid from month t+1 onwards
If t = ProjTerm() Then Return 0
Return (Surr_PV_e(t + 1) + SurrBen_IF_e(t + 1) ) * DiscFac_mnth(t + 1)

Formula.Name: TotExp_PV_e
Formula.Notes: Present value (at end of month t) for all expenses paid from month t+1 onwards
Formula.Value:
'Present Value at the end of month t of all expenses paid from month t+1 onwards
If t = ProjTerm() Then Return 0
Return (TotExp_PV_e(t + 1) + ExpRen_IF_e(t + 1) + ExpClaim_IF_e(t + 1) ) * DiscFac_mnth(t + 1) + ExpInit_b(t + 1)

Formula.Name: ValMnth
Formula.Notes: Number of months since valuation date
Formula.Value: '<Attributes(CalcOnce:=True)> Return t - PeriodIF()

Formula.Name: ValYr
Formula.Notes: Year of valuation, first 12 months immediately following the valuation date have ValnYear of 1
Formula.Value:
'<Attributes(CalcOnce:=True)> If ValMnth(t) < 0 Then Return CInt(Fix((ValMnth(t) - 11) / 12))
Return CInt(Fix((ValMnth(t) + 11) / 12))
